str2: Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
Early in the morning, at dawn. Adverb from pro; at dawn; by implication, the day-break watch.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of sumboulos; advisement; specially, a deliberative body, i.e. The provincial assessors or lay-court.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear away (sometimes with violence). From apo and phero; to bear off.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.
